intro: Capura, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep pink. Its leaves are large, palmately lobed, and often covered in fine hairs. Capura thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests.
